prayers.instructions: Pray the Angelus three times a day—traditionally at 6 a.m., 12 p.m., and 6 p.m. (or when the church bells ring). Stand, face east if possible, and make the Sign of the Cross before beginning.
prayers.title: The Angel of the Lord declared unto Mary
prayers.title_english: The Angel of the Lord declared unto Mary
prayers.latin:
℣. Angelus Domini nuntiavit Mariae. 
℟. Et concepit de Spiritu Sancto. 
Ave Maria, gratia plena, Dominus tecum; benedicta tu in mulieribus, et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Iesus. Sancta Maria, Mater Dei, ora pro nobis peccatoribus, nunc et in hora mortis nostrae. Amen.
prayers.english:
V/. The Angel of the Lord declared unto Mary. 
R/. And she conceived of the Holy Spirit. 
Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee; blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen.

prayers.instructions: Remain standing; bow the head at the Holy Name of Jesus. Repeat the Hail Mary after the versicle and response.
prayers.title: Behold the handmaid of the Lord
prayers.title_english: Behold the handmaid of the Lord
prayers.latin:
℣. Ecce ancilla Domini. 
℟. Fiat mihi secundum verbum tuum. 
Ave Maria, gratia plena, Dominus tecum; benedicta tu in mulieribus, et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Iesus. Sancta Maria, Mater Dei, ora pro nobis peccatoribus, nunc et in hora mortis nostrae. Amen.
prayers.english:
V/. Behold the handmaid of the Lord. 
R/. Be it done unto me according to Thy word. 
Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee; blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen.

prayers.instructions: Genuflect or bow deeply at the words 'And the Word was made flesh,' then rise to finish the verse and Hail Mary.
prayers.title: And the Word was made Flesh
prayers.title_english: And the Word was made Flesh
prayers.latin:
℣. Et Verbum caro factum est. 
℟. Et habitavit in nobis. 
Ave Maria, gratia plena, Dominus tecum; benedicta tu in mulieribus, et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Iesus. Sancta Maria, Mater Dei, ora pro nobis peccatoribus, nunc et in hora mortis nostrae. Amen.
prayers.english:
V/. And the Word was made Flesh. 
R/. And dwelt among us. 
Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee; blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen.

prayers.title: Pray for us, O holy Mother of God
prayers.title_latin: Ora pro nobis, sancta Dei Genetrix
prayers.title_english: Pray for us, O holy Mother of God
prayers.latin:
℣. Ora pro nobis, sancta Dei Genetrix. 
℟. Ut digni efficiamur promissionibus Christi.
prayers.english:
V/. Pray for us, O holy Mother of God. 
R/. That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ.

prayers.instructions: Collect (closing prayer); said with hands joined. Finish with the Sign of the Cross.
prayers.title: Let us pray
prayers.latin: Gratiam tuam, quaesumus, Domine, mentibus nostris infunde; ut qui, Angelo nuntiante, Christi Filii tui Incarnationem cognovimus, per Passionem eius et Crucem ad Resurrectionis gloriam perducamur. Per eundem Christum Dominum nostrum. Amen.
prayers.english: Pour forth, we beseech Thee, O Lord, Thy grace into our hearts; that we, to whom the Incarnation of Christ Thy Son was made known by the message of an angel, may by His Passion and Cross be brought to the glory of His Resurrection. Through the same Christ our Lord. Amen.
